description.narrative: IFC will provide a partial credit guarantee as part of a risk sharing facility of approximately MK2 billion with Standard Bank Malawi Limited (Standard Bank or the Bank), which will provide local lending to small and medium enterprises (SMEs) that distribute mobile telephone air time for Zain Malawi Limited (Zain). The proposed risk-sharing facility will enable Zains distributors to access financing from Standard Bank on favorable terms than currently available. The Project aims to: (i) provide Zains distributors with better access to financing on favorable terms; (ii) allow Standard Bank to expand its lending to this sector with lower risk of loss; and (iii) improve the ability of Zain to reach previously underserved market segments in Malawi. In addition to facilitating funding, IFC, in collaboration with our Advisory Services Unit, will provide a training and capacity building program for Zains distributors to help improve their management skills and credit profile.

The Project is expected to deliver strong development impact by:
Improving Access to Telecommunication Services: The financing of Zains distributors through this Project would help strengthen the capital base of the distributors, enabling them to expand to previously underserved regions of Malawi.
Catalytic Effect: The demand for financing by the SME sector in Malawi is mostly unmet due to the perceived lending risks involved. The Project would encourage Standard Bank to provide funding to Zains distributors, who are part of the SME sector, based on IFCs assumption of partial credit risk and the demonstrated viability of such a structure.
Job Creation: The Project would lead to creation of new jobs as the distributors will need additional staff to support their expanding businesses.
Capacity Building: The Project will provide needed training to Zains distributors that should help build their capacity and improve corporate governance.
